title: HAIM's 'Something to Tell You' is a Delightful Pop Album
summary: The album is full of catchy tunes, strong harmonies and lots of optimism. If you’re looking for a new album to add to your collection, you should definitely give HAIM’s 'Something to Tell You' a listen. The lyrics and harmonies are smooth and soft, with a subtle beat behind it. The song is about being in love and being certain that the person you're with is the person that you want and need in your life. It's about wanting everything and nothing at the same time.

With their sophomore album, \u2018Something to Tell You,\u2019 HAIM continues to be optimistic and uplifting with their new music. The album is a mix of upbeat pop tracks and slower ballads that showcase the sisters\u2019 harmony and vocals. Even if you aren't a fan of pop music, it's worth giving this album a listen.
The trio had been working on this album for some time before releasing it. In September 2016, they released three singles; \u201CRight Now,\u201D \u201CNew York Excuse\u201D and \u201CSentimentality.\u201D
And after a year-long hiatus following the release of these songs, HAIM announced via Instagram in June 2017 that they would finally be releasing their second studio album (and first extended play) later that year.
Luckily for us, they stuck to their word and released the nine-track EP on Sept. 14, just in time for our listening pleasure. Here are some of our favorite tracks from HAIM's 'Something To Tell You' Album:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

The lyrics and harmonies are smooth and soft, with a subtle beat behind it. The song is about being in love and being certain that the person you\u2019re with is the person you want and need in your life."),mdx("h2",null,"Want You Back"),mdx("p",null,"This song is reminiscent of HAIM\u2019s first album, \u2018Days Are Gone.\u2019 It\u2019s a blend of synth pop, R&B and a little bit of rock and roll. This song is about wanting someone who has left to come back. It\u2019s about hoping that the person you love is missing you and wants you back in their life and in their heart."),mdx("h2",null,"Little of Your Love"),mdx("p",null,"This is another slower track from the album, featuring the lyrics \u201CI need a little of your love/ I don\u2019t need everything you\u2019ve got/ I just need a little of your love.\u201D The song is about needing someone in your life and only wanting a little of their love, as opposed to needing everything they have. It\u2019s about wanting everything and nothing at the same time."),mdx("h2",null,"Ready for You"),mdx("p",null,"This is one of the more upbeat songs on the album and the first single released before the EP was released. The lyrics are extremely catchy and easy to memorize, even after only listening to it once. This song is about being ready for the person you love and being ready to be with them and commit to them. It\u2019s about knowing that you\u2019re ready for that special person in your life."),mdx("h2",null,"Running For Your Life"),mdx("p",null,"This is another slower track from the album that has a more R&B vibe. This is a passionate track about not being ready to commit to someone and wanting to run from them. The song is from the point of view of someone who is not ready to fully commit to another person and is running from them."),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t Give up Your Daydream"),mdx("p",null,"This upbeat track is the last song on the album. It\u2019s about not being ready to give up your dreams and to keep going even if you\u2019ve hit a few bumps along the way. It\u2019s about staying optimistic even when things aren\u2019t going as planned. This is a great message to send out to all the smudges out there. Keep fighting and don\u2019t give up!"),mdx("h2",null,"Together"),mdx("p",null,"This is the last track on the album (and the first track on the album that isn\u2019t a full-length song). It\u2019s a beautiful track about staying optimistic and being with someone who you love. It\u2019s about finding the person you love and being with them even when everything else seems to be going wrong."),mdx("h2",null,"Through It All"),mdx("p",null,"This is another slower track from the album. It\u2019s about being in a relationship and going through everything together. It\u2019s about being with someone who you love and being with them through good times and bad."),mdx("h2",null,"Epilogue: Yearning"),mdx("p",null,`This is the last song on the album. It\u2019s about wanting someone and knowing that you\u2019re not ready for a relationship. It\u2019s about being drawn to someone but not being able to be with them because you aren\u2019t ready to fully commit. What to expect?
This album is full of catchy tunes, strong harmonies and lots of optimism. If you\u2019re looking for a new album to add to your collection, you should definitely give HAIM\u2019s 'Something to Tell You' a listen.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Foster the People's 'Sacred Hearts Club' Is a Fun Ride
Charlie Puth's 'Voicenotes' Is a Solid Effort

intro.compiledSource:

He\u2019s also worked with some pretty big names (including one we\u2019ll get to shortly). Now, he\u2019s back with another new album, titled \u201CVoicenotes.\u201D It\u2019s a solid effort that shows growth and maturity, as well as keeping Puth\u2019s fun and lighthearted style.
At its core, Voicenotes is an acoustic pop album. However, it goes deeper than just putting electric guitars aside; these songs are stripped right down to the bare bones. There\u2019s still plenty of production value\u2014especially on the third track\u2014but it feels like Puth made a conscious decision not to hide behind anything.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The History of Hip Hop Music: The Influential Years

intro.compiledSource:
var u=Object.defineProperty,m=Object.defineProperties;var c=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var a=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var r=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,i=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var h=(e,o,t)=>o in e?u(e,o,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:t}):e[o]=t,s=(e,o)=>{for(var t in o||(o={}))r.call(o,t)&&h(e,t,o[t]);if(a)for(var t of a(o))i.call(o,t)&&h(e,t,o[t]);return e},p=(e,o)=>m(e,c(o));var l=(e,o)=>{var t={};for(var n in e)r.call(e,n)&&o.indexOf(n)<0&&(t[n]=e[n]);if(e!=null&&a)for(var n of a(e))o.indexOf(n)<0&&i.call(e,n)&&(t[n]=e[n]);return t};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(t){var n=t,{components:e}=n,o=l(n,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,p(s(s({},layoutProps),o),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`Hip hop music is a universal language. It has proven to be a way for people from different cultures and backgrounds to come together and express themselves. From its humble beginnings in New York City, hip hop has grown into a worldwide sensation, with local scenes spawning in cities across the globe. This article explores the history of hip-hop music, from its roots as an underground movement in the early 1980s to its predominance as one of the most popular genres today.
Fans of rap music are undoubtedly aware that this style of music has origins in New York City during the 1970s and 1980s, but there is much more to know about how exactly it came about and how it evolved over time. From breakdancing to rapping, we\u2019ll explore all of the elements that blended together to form what we now call \u201Chip-hop\u201D today.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "The Imitation Game" Is a Fascinating Look at the Life of Alan Turing

intro.compiledSource:
var m=Object.defineProperty,l=Object.defineProperties;var u=Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors;var r=Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;var s=Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty,i=Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable;var c=(e,t,n)=>t in e?m(e,t,{enumerable:!0,configurable:!0,writable:!0,value:n}):e[t]=n,o=(e,t)=>{for(var n in t||(t={}))s.call(t,n)&&c(e,n,t[n]);if(r)for(var n of r(t))i.call(t,n)&&c(e,n,t[n]);return e},h=(e,t)=>l(e,u(t));var d=(e,t)=>{var n={};for(var a in e)s.call(e,a)&&t.indexOf(a)<0&&(n[a]=e[a]);if(e!=null&&r)for(var a of r(e))t.indexOf(a)<0&&i.call(e,a)&&(n[a]=e[a]);return n};const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent(n){var a=n,{components:e}=a,t=d(a,["components"]);return mdx(MDXLayout,h(o(o({},layoutProps),t),{components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"}),mdx("p",null,`In 1937, Alan Turing was born in Northern England. He would go on to become a war hero, pioneer of computer science, and one of the greatest minds of the 20th century. In 1951, he was convicted of \u201Cgross indecency\u201D and chemically castrated as punishment. Two years later, he killed himself with cyanide. This is his story.
Turing was a brilliant man with many interests that went beyond mathematics and computer science: chess, cryptography, music theory and programming computers to sing are just some examples. This diverse background helped him crack the Nazi Enigma code during World War II at Bletchley Park (which has been nicknamed "Codebreaking Castle"). This saved countless lives and accelerated the end of the war by two years. After the war ended in 1945, Turing continued working as an cryptanalyst for a few more years before turning his attention to other interests \u2013- and it is these interests that led to his arrest and untimely death at age 41.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

But there are still some great pop albums that aren\u2019t filled with auto-tune and EDM drops.On May 25th, the Scottish band Chvrches released their third album called \u201C Love is Dead.\u201D The synth-pop band has lots of happy vibes and catchy hooks on their new album. It\u2019s a pleasant listen but might not be what you expect if you only know them from their first two albums. The band took a left turn creatively, covering topics like technology, isolation and death rather than dancing around in your bedroom to this record.
Chvrses has gained more popularity among a different group of fans by releasing this album than they ever did with their first two releases combined. This is partially because they have expanded their audience by collaborating on songs with Haim and Bleachers recently as well as making this change in sound so now they have crossover appeal to radio listeners too!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
